result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution is ordered in the amount of $3447.20 to be paid to Vigneshwar S., joint and several with Austin Cooper 15CF1531 and Sarah Parker 15CF1533.

Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO 11CF4921 AND CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE with credit for 401 days time served.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 7 years initial confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims Vigneshwar S., Dana G. and the co-actors:  Austin Cooper and Sarah Parker.

Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Case recalled:
Same appearances:

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  PSI reviewed and correctiions made.  Statements by the State, Defense.  Additional statement by Adrienne L.  

SENTENCE IS CONCURRENT TO 11CF4921 AND CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 12 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 8 years with credit for 401 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims Vigneshwar S., Dana G. and the co-actors:  Austin Cooper and Sarah Parker.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $3447.20 to be paid to Vigneshwar S., joint and several with Austin Cooper 15CF1531 and Sarah Parker 15CF1533.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 7 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel has not reviewed the PSI with his client.  Case passed to allow time for PSI to be reviewed.
Filed.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 678

Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 3/1/16 for Dana G., George A.. for 2 appearances each on  2/29/16, 3/1/16; Vigneshwar S. for 3 appearances on 2/29/16, 3/1/16, 3/2/16.
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, filed.
Filed.

On the same day, at the hour of 11:34 a.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:

"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY of Robbery by use of force, as a party to a crime, in the manner and form as charged in Count 1 in the Information.  Dated this 2nd day of March, 2016.  Bryant C., Foreperson."

On direction of the Court, deputy clerk polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed.  Court discharged the jury.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions and jury questions.  PSI ordered.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Case calendared for sentencing on April 21, 2016 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 9:25 am.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:21 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Leranth and Mazurczak who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury in box at 10:34 am to view video.   Jury out of box at 10:40 am.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:21 pm.  Sworn for the state:  West Allis Police Officer Lucas Binter.  Jury out of box at 1:38 pm.  Jury in box at 1:48 pm.  Continued sworn testimony from West Allis Police Officer Lucas Binter.  Sworn for the state:  Vigneshwar S., George A.  Jury out of box at 2:54 pm for a break.  Exhibits # 3, 4 offered and received.  Jury in box at 3:12 pm.  Sworn for the state:  Dana G., West Allis Detective Nick Stachula, West Allis Detective Daniel Ditorrice.  Jury out of box 4:25 pm.  Exhibit #1 offered and received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 4:41 pm.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Jury out of box at 4:43 pm.  Court recessed for the day.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  

  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 9:49 am.  Sworn for the state:  Vigneshwar S.   Jury out of box at 10:49 am for break.  Jury in box at 11:04 am.  Sworn for the state:  West Allis Police Officer Paul Taylor.  Jury out of box at 12:01 pm.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury panel in court at 1:38 pm.  Voir dire proceeded.  
Jury out of box at 2:48 pm.  Jury in box at 3:02 pm.   Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.    Jury out of box at 3:56 pm.  The Court denies defense's motion to strike the jury panel.  Jury in box at 4:18 pm.   Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Jury out of box at 4:42 pm.  Court recessed for the day.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  

  Jury trial scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury panel in court at 11:59 am and sworn.  Jurors out of box at 12:02 pm.  Jurors to report to Room 106 at 1:15 pm.  Court recessed for lunch.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  The state motions the Court for an adjournment, one of their witnesses is unavailable.  The Court grants the state's motion and orders case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The state requested this case be heard today to address jury trial issues.  The state motions the Court for an adjournment of the trial.   The Court would like defendant present in court.   Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 26.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties in court to schedule a date to adjourn jury trial.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference  on December 4, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.

Final pre-trial conference held.   Case remains calendared for jury trial December 14, 2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 26.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Lucy Kronforst fjor Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Counsel informed Court there has been a breakdown in communication.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Original PRELIMINARY HEARING Transcript (18 pages) commencing APRIL 20, 2015, received and filed.  jm

Attorney Cheryl Anne Ward in court, defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Jame Griffin on behalf of Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Paul Taylor, O-WAPD and Daniel Ditrice Detective-WAPD.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Vigneshwar S., ANY Day's Inn, George A., Southridge Mall, Dana G., Dustin G., Joseph J., James G., Remi C. and Co-defendants Austin Cooper, and Sarah Parker.

Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Michael Exhavier Dunn in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
